greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered factorizations of 4*n into even numbers.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(9)=4 because 9*4=36 can be factored as 36=18*2=2*18=6*6.
mathematica: nn = 300;f[list_, i] := list[[i]];a = Table[Boole[EvenQ[n]], {n, 1, nn}];Select[Map[Total, Transpose[NestList[Table[DirichletConvolve[f[#, n], f[a, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}] &, a, nn]]], # > 1 &] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 17 2015 *)
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 06 2005
